comments: This class was interesting. The lectures are never posted and you\'ll be typing all class. All exams are written, if you put in the work you will do good. I never used the books. Exams contain a lot of material so you\'ll need to study lots to get a good grade.

comments: Lidio is very passionate about anthropology, and a very knowledgeable professor. It\'s very easy to get an A in this class, but you will have to attend class unless you have a friend that could send you the notes since he doesn\'t post anything on blackboard. Very interesting class and prof, would take again!

comments: Beware of Lidio, he\'s pretty full of himself as an archaeologist and is the least helpful prof I\'ve ever had. He never answers questions instead saying "what do you think?", he doesn\'t use blackboard, he doesn\'t post study guides, exams pretty heavy on textbook stuff, and doesn\'t like it AT ALL if you disagree with his opinion on something

comments: Lidio has unclear expectations, assigns heavy reading, has fragmented slides, doesn\'t use BB, answers questions condescendingly, and stops class to scold anyone who is late or who leaves to use the bathroom. One opinion matters: his. Reiterate it and you\'ll pass, but beware of his unclear grading format. Exam formats are ALWAYS essay questions.

comments: Overall interesting class but this prof is hard to work with, he doesn\'t use BB, only way to get an A is to literally agree with whatever he says, even in your essays. No place for discussion of different opinions I learned this the hard way. Marks for participation, I participated every class in meaningful discussion still did horrible.

comments: Overall the class itself wasn\'t all that bad, but Lidio made it challenging. He does not post lecture slides and does not use BB whatsoever. If you ask him a question about the class he simply refers you to the course outline which he emails at the beginning of the term. He had a tendency to be rude as well. Despite all this, he was a fair marker.

comments: Lidio is not a fan of computers, and thus refuses to post any lectures on Blackboard. His lectures are long and based mostly off of his PowerPoint, so get ready to write everything down. His accent is difficult to understand at times, especially id you are not expecting it, which is unfortunate as he talks for the entire duration of the class.

comments: He is extremely unreasonable, does not use blackboard AT ALL, so you have no access to any classroom material, not even your classmates emails to contact them if you missed a class. His class avg is in 60\'s and that\'s because he expects you to quote his lecture notes as he does not understand paraphrasing. He\'s not approachable or helpful at all.

comments: He is very passionate about the subject and he expects people to participate. He does not use blackboard, due to this attendance is necessary. If you go and participate you will do fine. He is very nice and is willing to help if you ask him to. But if you struggle to understand accents or like to skip classes, he may not be your first choice.

comments: The textbooks are not used for tests or papers - don\'t buy them! Everything is based off lectures, which is problematic because Lidio has a VERY heavy accent, and lecture slides are unorganized and chaotic. Nothing is online. His opinion is the only one that matters, don\'t bother having your own views on his points.

comments: Lidio is an awesome prof. He\'s a seasoned archaeologist who really knows what he\'s talking about, he\'s been there. He has passion and care about his students. He doesn\'t use Blackboard, which is a pain, but powerpoints are straightforward. Go to class, study your class notes & read the text, you\'ll pass no problem.

comments: Don\'t expect a light course load with Lidio. Be prepared to take copious amounts of notes. His lectures are guided by PowerPoint slides that are sometimes confusing to follow, but never short of information. He has a devout passion for archaeology and wishes for his students to succeed, though he can be tricky with his exam format.

comments: Lidio is passionate about his subject and will always encourage his students in every way. Group projects are frustrating, as you have to rely on others for a good grade. Participation is a must in class, but easy. All exams are based on powerpoints talked about in class. Exams are easy if you study your lecture notes.

comments: Lidio really needs to update his views about technology. He doesn\'t use BB at all, which takes away everything including the discussion board for that class. Lidio uses too many generalizations. e.g. "there is no trace of women in science before the 1980s." You get better grades the more you agree with him - use his ideas instead of your own.

comments: Lidio has become one of my fav profs at Macewan. He is really passionate about anthropology which I respect. When I went to his office, he always encouraged me and gave me advice about school and life. He wants everyone to do well. His exams do require a lot of studying and missing a class is not an option. I would take another class with him.

comments: The previous rating is very confusing. The final exam was two long answer questions and he encouraged us to write for the full 3 hours. The exams were straightforward, he marked fairly easily. BUT the class was insufferable so dry and it seemed he knew nothing about the subject matter outside of what was in the text. I would not recommend.
